pullrequest.title: Fix faulty Bounding Box in Bullet and Dart when collision elements with relative transforms present

content.raw:
A few more details for the interested reader ;)

I asked myself, if ``BulletCollision`` does not consider the relative pose, why was it then working in the simulation at all?    
*Answer:* it seems to only affect the bounding box (though it may affect other functions, e.g. in [OnPoseChange](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a3a7c53ea929b09fc14730b45ef5ad060c47c7ca/gazebo/physics/bullet/BulletCollision.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#BulletCollision.cc-67) there strangely is something that was commented out...).    
*Reason:* In [BulletLink::Init](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a3a7c53ea929b09fc14730b45ef5ad060c47c7ca/gazebo/physics/bullet/BulletLink.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#BulletLink.cc-131) the collision shape is added to bullet engine as a compound shape, passing the relative pose there. This ensures that the objects are managed with their correct transforms within Bullet internally.
However when just getting the bounding box, [BulletCollision::BoundingBox()](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a3a7c53ea929b09fc14730b45ef5ad060c47c7ca/gazebo/physics/bullet/BulletCollision.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#BulletCollision.cc-138) does not consider the relative position of the ``Collision`` shape within the compound. Therefore, previous ``Link::BoundingBox()`` returns the wrong values, not considering the transform.

So how is this done in ODE?

[ODECollision::BoundingBox()](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a3a7c53ea929b09fc14730b45ef5ad060c47c7ca/gazebo/physics/ode/ODECollision.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ODECollision.cc-177) uses the ``collisionId`` of the shape added to ODE with ``dGeomGetAABB``. It doesn't explicitly query the relative pose, so it relies on that the relative pose is already encoded in ``collisionId``.
This is done in [ODELink::UpdateCollisionOffsets](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a3a7c53ea929b09fc14730b45ef5ad060c47c7ca/gazebo/physics/ode/ODELink.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ODELink.cc-325). This is called from ``ODELink::Init()``, so it is ensured that it is called in the beginning.
content.html:
A few more details for the interested reader ;)

I asked myself, if BulletCollision does not consider the relative pose, why was it then working in the simulation at all?
Answer: it seems to only affect the bounding box (though it may affect other functions, e.g. in OnPoseChange there strangely is something that was commented out...).
Reason: In BulletLink::Init the collision shape is added to bullet engine as a compound shape, passing the relative pose there. This ensures that the objects are managed with their correct transforms within Bullet internally. However when just getting the bounding box, BulletCollision::BoundingBox() does not consider the relative position of the Collision shape within the compound. Therefore, previous Link::BoundingBox() returns the wrong values, not considering the transform.

So how is this done in ODE?

ODECollision::BoundingBox() uses the collisionId of the shape added to ODE with dGeomGetAABB. It doesn't explicitly query the relative pose, so it relies on that the relative pose is already encoded in collisionId. This is done in ODELink::UpdateCollisionOffsets. This is called from ODELink::Init(), so it is ensured that it is called in the beginning.

pullrequest.title: Fix faulty Bounding Box in Bullet and Dart when collision elements with relative transforms present

content.raw:
Hi @JenniferBuehler,
Do you think `DARTCollision::BoundingBox()` has the same issue? `DARTCollision::Init()` makes a call to `dart::dynamics::ShapeNode::setRelativeTransform`, which looks like it should set the relative transformation. Because this is called in DARTCollision instead of DARTLink, I wonder whether the internal bounding box even has the correct transformation.
content.html: Hi @JenniferBuehler, Do you think DARTCollision::BoundingBox() has the same issue? DARTCollision::Init() makes a call to dart::dynamics::ShapeNode::setRelativeTransform, which looks like it should set the relative transformation. Because this is called in DARTCollision instead of DARTLink, I wonder whether the internal bounding box even has the correct transformation.

pullrequest.title: Fix faulty Bounding Box in Bullet and Dart when collision elements with relative transforms present

content.raw: Hi Peter, yes dart has the same issue. Internally it is fine because of the `ShapeNode::setRelativeTransform` which you mentioned (see also my last post, same as for bullet). But the bounding box computed for `Model` was wrong just as in bullet. I think `Model::BoundingBox()` is not needed at crucial places, at least it isn't needed for the underlying simulation (in dart or bullet). That's why it may not have been noticed before.  I only noticed it because I needed the bounding box for some tests and I was using the `Model` interface to get it.
content.html: Hi Peter, yes dart has the same issue. Internally it is fine because of the ShapeNode::setRelativeTransform which you mentioned (see also my last post, same as for bullet). But the bounding box computed for Model was wrong just as in bullet. I think Model::BoundingBox() is not needed at crucial places, at least it isn't needed for the underlying simulation (in dart or bullet). That's why it may not have been noticed before. I only noticed it because I needed the bounding box for some tests and I was using the Model interface to get it.

pullrequest.title: Fix faulty Bounding Box in Bullet and Dart when collision elements with relative transforms present

content.raw: Hmmmm I see what you mean with the doubts on whether dart has the right transform internally, I didn't actually check that separately. Good point, will look into it
content.html: Hmmmm I see what you mean with the doubts on whether dart has the right transform internally, I didn't actually check that separately. Good point, will look into it

pullrequest.title: Fix faulty Bounding Box in Bullet and Dart when collision elements with relative transforms present

content.raw: Looking at this again more closely: no, it should not be an issue.  `DARTCollision::Init()` does call `this->RelativePose()` , which returns the correct relative pose. The issue with bullet was that `this->RelativePose()` was not called at all *for the bounding box*. In DART,  `ShapeNode::setRelativeTransform()` is called in `DARTCollision::Init()`  with the correct transform.
content.html: Looking at this again more closely: no, it should not be an issue. DARTCollision::Init() does call this->RelativePose() , which returns the correct relative pose. The issue with bullet was that this->RelativePose() was not called at all for the bounding box. In DART, ShapeNode::setRelativeTransform() is called in DARTCollision::Init() with the correct transform.

pullrequest.title: Fix faulty Bounding Box in Bullet and Dart when collision elements with relative transforms present

content.raw: I see. `DARTCollision::Init()` properly sets the relative pose, but then `DARTCollision::BoundingBox()` uses the underlying shape from the `dtCollisionShape` object, which does not include the relative transform.
content.html: I see. DARTCollision::Init() properly sets the relative pose, but then DARTCollision::BoundingBox() uses the underlying shape from the dtCollisionShape object, which does not include the relative transform.

pullrequest.title: Fix faulty Bounding Box in Bullet and Dart when collision elements with relative transforms present

content.raw:
I forgot to mention, the style is to start function parameters with underscores (e.g. const Float _val) and group pointer and reference indicators with the variable (e.g. ignition::math::Vector3d &_v as opposed to ignition::math::Vector3d& _v).
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=contrib_code&cat=development#Style
content.html: I forgot to mention, the style is to start function parameters with underscores (e.g. const Float _val) and group pointer and reference indicators with the variable (e.g. ignition::math::Vector3d &_v as opposed to ignition::math::Vector3d& _v). http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=contrib_code&cat=development#Style
